jsDoc.description:
Escape HTML special characters to prevent XSS attacks

jsDoc.example:
```typescript
escapeHtml('<script>alert("XSS")</script>')
// Returns: '<script>alert("XSS")</script>'
```

jsDoc.description:

original character representations.

```typescript unescapeHtml('<div>Hello</div>') // Returns: '
Hello
' ```

jsDoc.description:
Escape HTML attributes (includes additional characters for attribute safety)

In addition to standard HTML escaping, this also escapes newlines and
carriage returns which can be problematic in HTML attributes.

params.name: text
params.description: - Text to be used in an HTML attribute

jsDoc.example:
```typescript
escapeAttribute('Click\nHere')
// Returns: 'Click
Here'
```

ScreenshotPluginOptions.name: ScreenshotPluginOptions

jsDoc.description:
Remark plugin that transforms screenshot code blocks into HTML divs for hydration

Web screenshot (simple):
```screenshot:homepage
https://example.com
```

Web screenshot (with config):
```screenshot:dashboard
url: http://localhost:3000/dashboard
viewport: 1280x720
selector: .main
fullPage: true
```

CLI screenshot:
```screenshot:build
type: cli
command: npm run build
theme: dracula
```

Remark plugin to transform {@symbol} references into documentation

Inline syntax: {@SymbolName} or {@path/hint#SymbolName}
Block syntax: :::reference SymbolName

Examples:
  - {@RequestState} â†’ links to type definition with hover tooltip
  - {@implementors/types#SessionState} â†’ disambiguated reference
  - :::reference Implementor â†’ full API documentation block

MDsveX/Remark plugin to transform Mermaid code blocks into renderable diagrams Transforms: ```mermaid graph TD A --> B ``` Into:
Which is then rendered client-side by mermaid.js
Configuration options for the links plugin

Remark plugin to rewrite .md links to proper site paths

Transforms markdown links like:
- [Guide](guides/cli.md) â†’ /docs/guides/cli
- [API](../reference/api.md) â†’ /docs/reference/api
- [README](../README.md) â†’ /README (outside /docs)
- [External](https://example.com) â†’ unchanged

This allows markdown files to use .md extensions (for GitHub viewing)
while rendering proper site paths in the documentation.

KaTeXOptions.name: KaTeXOptions

jsDoc.description: Configuration options for math rendering with KaTeX

MathNode.name: MathNode

jsDoc.description: Math node metadata extracted from markdown

renderMath.name: renderMath

jsDoc.description: Render LaTeX math expression to HTML using KaTeX

params.name: displayMode
params.description: - Render as display (block) or inline math

renderMath.signature: function renderMath(latex: string, displayMode: boolean, options: KaTeXOptions = {}): string

jsDoc.description:
Remark plugin for rendering mathematical equations with KaTeX

Supports both inline and display (block) math:
- Inline math: `$E = mc^2$` - renders within text flow
- Display math: `$$\frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}$$` - centered block

Features:
- Server-side rendering (no client JavaScript required)
- Custom macros for reusable expressions
- Graceful error handling with inline error messages
- Trust mode for advanced LaTeX commands (\url, \href)
- Compatible with dark mode via CSS

Parse inline and block math from markdown

This is a simple parser that extracts math delimiters:
- Inline: `$...$`
- Block: `$$...$$`

Note: In most cases, you should use `remark-math` which provides
more robust parsing. This is provided as a lightweight alternative.

ImageOptimizationOptions.name: ImageOptimizationOptions

jsDoc.description: Configuration for image optimization plugin

ImageMetadata.name: ImageMetadata

jsDoc.description: Image metadata for optimization

Remark plugin for automatic image optimization

Transforms markdown images into optimized images with:
- Multiple formats (WebP, AVIF)
- Responsive sizes with srcset
- Lazy loading with blur placeholder
- Click-to-zoom functionality

Usage:
```markdown
![Screenshot of dashboard](./dashboard.png)
![Logo](./logo.svg?width=200&height=100)
```

Configuration:
```typescript
import { imageOptimizationPlugin } from '@goobits/docs-engine/plugins';

remarkPlugins: [
  imageOptimizationPlugin({
    formats: ['webp', 'avif', 'original'],
    sizes: [640, 960, 1280, 1920],
    lazy: true,
    zoom: true
  })
]
```

Remark plugin to transform filetree code blocks into interactive file trees Transforms: ```filetree src/ â”œâ”€â”€ lib/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ utils.ts â””â”€â”€ main.ts ``` Into:
Which is then rendered client-side by the FileTree component

Remark plugin to transform :::collapse directives to HTML <details> elements

Transforms directives like:
:::collapse{title="Section Title" open=true}
Content here...
:::

Into interactive collapsible sections with:
- Native <details>/<summary> elements
- Smooth animations (CSS-based)
- Chevron icon rotation
- Accessible keyboard navigation

jsDoc.description:

Remark plugin for advanced code block highlighting with Shiki

Features:
- Syntax highlighting with Shiki
- Line highlighting: `{1,3-5}`
- Line numbers: `showLineNumbers`
- File titles: `title="filename"`
- Diff support: `diff` language with +/- prefixes
- Copy button (integrated with CodeCopyButton component)

Remark plugin to transform GitHub/Obsidian-style callouts

Transforms blockquotes like:
> [!NOTE]
> This is a note

Or with custom titles:
> [!TIP] Custom Title Here
> This is a tip with a custom title

Supports: NOTE, TIP, IMPORTANT, WARNING, CAUTION, SUCCESS, DANGER, INFO, QUESTION

Into styled HTML callouts with icons and enhanced markdown rendering
